blog.name: winterfellchild
blog.title: The pack survives
blog.description:
"She (Daenerys) has the power to destroy, she can wipe out entire cities, and we
certainly see that in ‘Fire and Blood.’ We see the dragons wiping out 
entire armies, wiping out towns and cities, destroying them, but that 
doesn’t necessarily enable you to rule — it just enables you to destroy." GRRM

tags: we are saying it for a while now
but a confirmation from an official source is always good
summary: Kit Harington - September 20, 2018 (x) Sophie Turner - July 20, 2017 (x)          Well, it’s pretty obvious that Jon and Sansa...
caption:
Kit Harington - September 20, 2018 (x)

Sophie Turner - July 20, 2017 (x)        

Well, it’s pretty obvious that Jon and Sansa are Ned/Cat 2.0 since season 6 but there are antis out there who still think that this is just our delusional idea so it’s nice to have a confirmation from both KH and ST that we were right: they were supposed to be just like Ned and Cat.

summary: Game of Thrones AU: The Eight Queens of Westeros Daenerys Targaryen, Queen of Dragonstone, Queen of Meereen, Khaleesi of the...
caption:
Game of Thrones AU: The Eight Queens of Westeros

Daenerys Targaryen, Queen of Dragonstone, Queen of Meereen, Khaleesi of the Great Grass Sea;
Roslin Tully, Queen of the Riverlands;
Sarella Martell, Queen of Dorne;
Asha Greyjoy, Queen of the Iron Islands;
Sansa Stark, Queen in the North, Queen of the Vale;
Talla Tarly, Queen of the Kingdom of the Reach;
Arya Stark, Queen of the Stormlands;
Brienne Tarth, Queen of the Westerlands

blog.name: asknightqueendany
blog.title: Ask the Night Queen
blog.description: Main blog: nightqueendany.tumblr.com. This blog is strictly dedicated to asks. Any asks I get on the other blog, I will repost here.

summary: >>Joff/Sansa makes you laugh. I know Right! Her trauma is amusing for me too, the way she's forced to marry a man twice her age,...
question: >>Joff/Sansa makes you laugh. I know Right! Her trauma is amusing for me too, the way she's forced to marry a man twice her age, whose family murdered hers. Hilarious! It was so funny when Joff forced her to look at her father's severed head. Don't even get me started on how he used to strip her naked and made his guards beat her. Hallelujah! Finding Joffery and Sansa ship-able really explains why you ship jonerys too. Such high quality takes. Wow!
answer: OMG fuckface I said it was more based on the chemistry Sophie and Jack had than the actual characters. Get over yourself. People ship Dany and Drogo and he raped her. And considering there are 454 works on A03 right now with a Sansa/Joffrey pairing, I really don’t feel that bad about it anyway. My asker asked for Crackships so I named one of mine. But you wouldn’t know what a “crackship” is would you? Considering you can’t tell a crackship from actual canon because I’m guessing you’re a Jonsa stan…which is, my dear, a crackship.

blog.title: Sansa is driving bitches to the insane asylum

summary:
Please
Jonsa fans never restrain yourselves from posting in the Jon snow, Game of
thrones or GOT  tag.  It doesn’t matter what...
body:
Please Jonsa fans never restrain yourselves from posting in the Jon snow, Game of thrones or GOT  tag. 

It doesn’t matter what the antis say, those tags ARE NOT exclusive to any ship.

I actually never  post Jonsa stuff on any of them, but in the light of recent events I’m going to start doing it. Just to piss out a bitter b*tch.

title: No Need for Speed
body:
read it on the AO3 at https://ift.tt/2MQ3wJz

by MaxBetta

At the urging of her closest friends, Sansa Stark attends a speed dating event. The men there are less than desirable, but one rogue manages to catch her attention.

blog.name: keylethkat
blog.title: KeylethKat/Opal Dragon Writes
blog.description: Published author and now freelance writer. For my services click here: https://www.fiverr.com/opal_dragon 27 INFP ♥️ Married to my BFF, mom of a wild toddler. Trashy romance novels are LIFE.

body:
Watching Reign/GoT parallels

I’ve been watching Reign. Though full of historical inaccuracy, I LOVE the focus on strong female characters and their strong ties together. Something rare and wonderful in the fantasy and historical genre. I hope more authors take note.

I am really struggling with the rape scene though. I loved how strong she has been despite how traumatized she is. Getting her revenge on her rapist like Sansa Stark did in Game of Thrones was very satisfying. I actually find her struggle to feel safe again far more realistic than Sansa’s or at the least Reign spent more time showing it. I’m so very glad that Mary had friends to talk to and a mother-in-law who experienced the same to empathize with. Poor Sansa hasn’t had anyone to discuss it with, she has siblings that off handedly mention it without a care (Bran and Arya) and her one ally in getting herself justice is gone at the moment (Jon). Brienne is her sworn shield and there seems to be a distance there and they don’t seem to confide in one another. The last season of Game of Thrones was very rushed so perhaps they happened behind the scenes but i truly wish that if traumatizing things happen in shows that they take the time to discuss the aftermath as they have done with Mary in Reign

summary: Can we all give a moment to think about Cat brushing Sansa’s hair? Think about it- in addition to her duties as Lady of...
question: Can we all give a moment to think about Cat brushing Sansa’s hair? Think about it- in addition to her duties as Lady of Winterfell Arya’s pretty much running wild with Ned enabling her, Rickon is a hyper child & Bran is literally climbing the walls. But Cat makes time at the end of the day to brush her daughter’s hair and let her know that she’s loved
answer:
“Men would say she had my look, but she will grow into a woman far more beautiful than I ever was, you can see that. I often sent away her maid so I could brush her hair myself. She had auburn hair, lighter than mine, and so thick and soft … the red in it would catch the light of the torches and shine like copper.”

It’s a simple line but it says so much! To make time for such an ordinary and mundane thing- when there are others to do it for you- for no reason other than you want to, and to find such joy in it. Cat must’ve taken so much pride in Sansa, must’ve loved to be around her if she found excuses to be close to her. And taken pride in not only their shared looks, but how Sansa would one day surpass her in beauty too. The most heartbreaking bit is the small details; the shine of her hair, how it looked in the light, like she’s collecting every bit of her memory of her. And in her worst, most agonizing moments, this is the memory she clings too. Ah, Cat.

I just love the small things that are filled with quiet affection, especially in familial relationships in this series. I have nothing good to say on Ned’s astonishingly poor parenting of Sansa in King’s Landing (perhaps poor is the wrong word; that implies he bothered at all) but there’s one moment that stood out from the first read. It’s when he discovers the incest from an unwitting Sansa, and thinks to himself that one day when she’s older, he’ll tell her how she helped him figure it out, how she made it so clear for him. There’s something so sad and sweet about that line when aware of his death, I don’t know, it always stuck with me. Thinking about Sansa and either of her parents is just generally very bittersweet.

And taken pride in not only their shared looks, but how Sansa would one day surpass her in beauty too. The most heartbreaking bit is the small details; the shine of her hair, how it looked in the light, like she’s collecting every bit of her memory of her. And in her worst, most agonizing moments, this is the memory she clings too. Ah, Cat.

I just love the small things that are filled with quiet affection, especially in familial relationships in this series. I have nothing good to say on Ned’s astonishingly poor parenting of Sansa in King’s Landing (perhaps poor is the wrong word; that implies he bothered at all) but there’s one moment that stood out from the first read. It’s when he discovers the incest from an unwitting Sansa, and thinks to himself that one day when she’s older, he’ll tell her how she helped him figure it out, how she made it so clear for him. There’s something so sad and sweet about that line when aware of his death, I don’t know, it always stuck with me. Thinking about Sansa and either of her parents is just generally very bittersweet.

summary: Tinfoil Hat Time: Sansa versus Daenerys
title: Tinfoil Hat Time: Sansa versus Daenerys
body:
Sansa’s “passionate fight” (courtesy of Sophie T.) – Is she going to fight for Jon? I hope not.

I don’t want it to be two women fighting for the hero of the story, who is Jon Snow (it is known). If it’s like that than Dany can have him. 

Back to Dany and Sansa:

I want Sansa to fight her feelings. I don’t want her to let them win. Because this would be consistent with the Sansa I have seen. She has not acknowledged her feelings to the extent that perhaps Jon has already. Sansa is done with romantic love. And even if Jon’s truth comes to light, I don’t see Sansa coming up with the  “hey let’s just marry” solution. Especially in light of Jon and Dany’s relationship.

It sucks, but I think Sansa may be Jonsa (political) marriage’s biggest opposition at first. I think that when she finds out about Jon (his parentage, his relationship with Dany, and his love for Sansa), Sansa will be hurt overall. She will continue to support his claim. She will fight the Northern Lords for Jon’s claim. This is because she does not want to be the Key to the North again.  But she won’t accept Jon in a romantic way. Not right away. Especially when faced with Jon’s antics and the possibility that Dany may be pregnant.

I picture Sansa fighting the marriage passionately, Dany being enraged by it, and Jon in his mind going “Yes!!!” Every time I envision his openly going for Sansa in this context, I’m reminded of all the men who have hurt her, used her, and used her “key” status. And I think she will be too. So Jon may go for it, but he may not too. And I’m not sure which is better for him long term.

I picture Jon saying nothing aloud for atleast half the season about the way he feels. He loves Sansa. I am convinced that he will be convinced that saying anything to Sansa about how he feels would just hurt her. So he needs to let his actions speak for him. Like how he left her the North. That scene was so beautiful and wonderful.

I picture Dany fighting for Jon with everything she’s got. Using the possibility or reality of a pregnancy. Their shared heritage. Their love. His bending the knee. Her dragons. The fact that while Sansa is his blood, so is she. She is an emotionally driven woman, so I do think this is entirely possible. 

I envision Dany arriving at Winterfell and immediately sizing Sansa up. I am convinced Dany will propose a Tyrion and Sansa re-marriage. That she will try and force Sansa to acquiesce. Sansa will stay strong. Even if it’s not Dany who proposes this, I think she’ll like it and support it in that Queenly way of hers, and Sansa will make her allegiance clear.

Dany will want Sansa out of the way maybe within moments of meeting her. Even if Jon and Sansa are siblings only, meddlesome sisters of dudes who you are in a relationship with are annoying. In her eyes if Jon is her man, and he has bent the knee as the King in the North, then his sister can’t be the Lady of Winterfell. Winterfell is the “seat” of the North. Possibly. I don’t picture Dany being magnanimous about this. Because she never is. And she has never had to “share” her men before. Drogo was all hers. She enjoyed this. Daario was all hers. Jorah is all hers. Tyrion is all hers too (even fighting against his family). Every man in her life is all hers. The only significant man her life that isn’t hers is Greyworm. And that is because he belongs to Missendai and Dany thought him incapable of sex for a good long while. But I’m being uncharitable here now, so I’ll stop.

When Sansa says no to Tyrion, she may herself propose another alliance. A short-lived betrothal to Theon (don’t shoot, I wrote a meta about this long ago that I later deleted when I was off Tumblr (Sansa, a future Queen, was raised with 3 secret future kings – Robb, Jon, and Theon. Possibly a 4th if you count Bran). If Yara dies, Theon is a King. Kitten-rage-Jon, ready, steady Go!). Perhaps. All I am saying here. Perhaps.Maybe they get married?

Theon will trip and jump his way over and kitten-rage-Jon will watch with hawk eyes.

I want Sansa to be her breathtaking, gentle, beloved self and I want Dany to burn with curiosity and jealousy alike. Angst is my goddess.

I do not want Sansa fighting Dany over Jon. Jon is the one who banged his aunt and may be in love with his cousin. Like I said before, that fight is now Jon’s, and Jon’s alone.

The thing about Sansa too – she is classy. She only fights back when she has reached her limit – “No More”. This is arguably one of the truest things about Sansa. So much so that viewers criticize her for being a coward and weak. She didn’t take back Winterfell for power, she took it back because that was the only way for their family to be safe.

Dany, on the other hand – loves power. She is used to having men fall for her left right and centre. She has never had to compete with another woman. So this will be interesting. Because I picture a one-sided competition. No matter how objective I try to be. Really!

I say this because Sansa is someone with wavering confidence. I think she might retreat emotionally from Jon once she learns the extent of his relationship with Dany. Even if she is jealous of Dany, she is much too careful and distrusting to play at a foolish love game when all their necks are on the line.  

So there you have it. A triangle of sorts. But not a real threat to Sansa. She will be fine with or without Jon. I can’t say the same for him though!

blog.name: janiedean
blog.title: she died as she lived: Done™️ and stanning jaime lannister
blog.description: but 30, Italian. goes to marches, procrastination central, fails at being brief. certified springsteen & western movies trash. the mithocondria of the throbb fandom cell. obi-wan braimenobi. writes too much fanfic. robb stark defense squad now and always. fish swim, even black ones, damn it. janie_tangerine on ao3.

tags: IDEK IF THIS IS A PHOTOSET A PICSPAM OR WHATEVER I hope it works ;_;
also the minific is because i can't keep my mouth shut ops
summary: theon on the salt throne & theon and sansa five years after the show, for @mrs-storm-andrews // @theongreyjoyexchange; [x] “It’s...
caption:
theon on the salt throne & theon and sansa five years after the show, for @mrs-storm-andrews // @theongreyjoyexchange; [x]

“It’s been quite some time, hasn’t it?”

It has, Theon thinks, for the both of them. He’s not going to speak for himself, but he can speak for her - five years later and she looks thriving. Her hair is longer and still that bright, beautiful auburn, she’s not as thin as she looked when they jumped from the ramparts a life ago, and she’s holding herself up straight like a queen would. She was also during the Long Night, but they never had much of a chance to talk then.

They seemingly do now.

“Yes,” he agrees. “And - you chose the only good time of the year to be here, I think.”

“Really. Why’s that?”

He shrugs, looking at how the sunlight hits her hair, at how they seem the only bright and vibrant thing in this entire shore.

“It rains most of the time,” he shrugs. “If not, there’s not much sunlight to spare anyway.”

“You seem to have grown to like it, though.”

“Like it?” He almost smiles, almost. She moves closer, looking up at him.

“Well, you sound almost fond talking about it.”

Fair - he might have grown to… maybe not like it, but embrace it. Not that he had planned to, but after he did save his sister and killed his uncle, and good riddance to him, people did apparently want him to have what should have been his from the beginning.

And seems like now that he doesn’t really want it as much, he’s doing better with it than he might have had a lifetime ago.

“Could be worse,” he says, cautiously.

“I cannot say it did you any bad,” Sansa says. “You look good.”

“Do I?” He asks, figuring that he might, if anything because it would be hard to look worse than he had when they - when they ran.

“I daresay that crown becomes you,” she says. He has to smile back, slightly. He’s learned to do it so that what of his teeth were broken don’t show.

“And being in Winterfell again has become you, I think,” he says. She’s here on a diplomatic visit, and she’s supposed to stay a while, and Theon doesn’t know what Jon sent her here to discuss, but she does seem to be happy to be here, at least. Her eyes turn a warmer shade of blue as she moves to his side.

“Good to know we seem to be doing better than we had imagined a while ago then.”

He nods. “That’s - that’s for sure.”

“Well,” she says, “I suppose you should show me around some, shouldn’t you?”

“I should hope I learned at least to be a decent host,” he says, and it comes out dry, the way it might have when - before King Robert ever showed up in Winterfell, truth to be told. He holds out an arm, shivering for a moment, realizing that maybe he shouldn’t have -

Sansa links hers through his own a moment later without hesitation. Her cheeks are slightly tinged because of the cold, but she looks right at home in Pyke’s pale sunlight. “I shall be glad to find out,” she smiles, and he smiles back, not thinking about hiding the broken teeth.

He thinks he shall be, too.

“Yes,” he agrees. “And - you chose the only good time of the year to be here, I think.”

“Really. Why’s that?”

He shrugs, looking at how the sunlight hits her hair, at how they seem the only bright and vibrant thing in this entire shore.

“It rains most of the time,” he shrugs. “If not, there’s not much sunlight to spare anyway.”

“You seem to have grown to like it, though.”

“Like it?” He almost smiles, almost. She moves closer, looking up at him.

“Well, you sound almost fond talking about it.”

Fair - he might have grown to… maybe not like it, but embrace it. Not that he had planned to, but after he did save his sister and killed his uncle, and good riddance to him, people did apparently want him to have what should have been his from the beginning.

And seems like now that he doesn’t really want it as much, he’s doing better with it than he might have had a lifetime ago.

“Could be worse,” he says, cautiously.

“I cannot say it did you any bad,” Sansa says. “You look good.”

“Do I?” He asks, figuring that he might, if anything because it would be hard to look worse than he had when they - when they ran.

“I daresay that crown becomes you,” she says. He has to smile back, slightly. He’s learned to do it so that what of his teeth were broken don’t show.

“And being in Winterfell again has become you, I think,” he says. She’s here on a diplomatic visit, and she’s supposed to stay a while, and Theon doesn’t know what Jon sent her here to discuss, but she does seem to be happy to be here, at least. Her eyes turn a warmer shade of blue as she moves to his side.

“Good to know we seem to be doing better than we had imagined a while ago then.”

He nods. “That’s - that’s for sure.”

“Well,” she says, “I suppose you should show me around some, shouldn’t you?”

“I should hope I learned at least to be a decent host,” he says, and it comes out dry, the way it might have when - before King Robert ever showed up in Winterfell, truth to be told. He holds out an arm, shivering for a moment, realizing that maybe he shouldn’t have -

Sansa links hers through his own a moment later without hesitation. Her cheeks are slightly tinged because of the cold, but she looks right at home in Pyke’s pale sunlight. “I shall be glad to find out,” she smiles, and he smiles back, not thinking about hiding the broken teeth.

He thinks he shall be, too.
trail.content:
theon on the salt throne & theon and sansa five years after the show, for @mrs-storm-andrews // @theongreyjoyexchange; [x]

“It’s been quite some time, hasn’t it?”

It has, Theon thinks, for the both of them. He’s not going to speak for himself, but he can speak for her - five years later and she looks thriving. Her hair is longer and still that bright, beautiful auburn, she’s not as thin as she looked when they jumped from the ramparts a life ago, and she’s holding herself up straight like a queen would. She was also during the Long Night, but they never had much of a chance to talk then.

They seemingly do now.

“Yes,” he agrees. “And - you chose the only good time of the year to be here, I think.”

“Really. Why’s that?”

He shrugs, looking at how the sunlight hits her hair, at how they seem the only bright and vibrant thing in this entire shore.

“It rains most of the time,” he shrugs. “If not, there’s not much sunlight to spare anyway.”

“You seem to have grown to like it, though.”

“Like it?” He almost smiles, almost. She moves closer, looking up at him.

“Well, you sound almost fond talking about it.”

Fair - he might have grown to… maybe not like it, but embrace it. Not that he had planned to, but after he did save his sister and killed his uncle, and good riddance to him, people did apparently want him to have what should have been his from the beginning.

And seems like now that he doesn’t really want it as much, he’s doing better with it than he might have had a lifetime ago.

“Could be worse,” he says, cautiously.

“I cannot say it did you any bad,” Sansa says. “You look good.”

“Do I?” He asks, figuring that he might, if anything because it would be hard to look worse than he had when they - when they ran.

“I daresay that crown becomes you,” she says. He has to smile back, slightly. He’s learned to do it so that what of his teeth were broken don’t show.

“And being in Winterfell again has become you, I think,” he says. She’s here on a diplomatic visit, and she’s supposed to stay a while, and Theon doesn’t know what Jon sent her here to discuss, but she does seem to be happy to be here, at least. Her eyes turn a warmer shade of blue as she moves to his side.

“Good to know we seem to be doing better than we had imagined a while ago then.”

He nods. “That’s - that’s for sure.”

“Well,” she says, “I suppose you should show me around some, shouldn’t you?”

“I should hope I learned at least to be a decent host,” he says, and it comes out dry, the way it might have when - before King Robert ever showed up in Winterfell, truth to be told. He holds out an arm, shivering for a moment, realizing that maybe he shouldn’t have -

Sansa links hers through his own a moment later without hesitation. Her cheeks are slightly tinged because of the cold, but she looks right at home in Pyke’s pale sunlight. “I shall be glad to find out,” she smiles, and he smiles back, not thinking about hiding the broken teeth.

He thinks he shall be, too.

blog.name: josie817
blog.title: keep on beating
blog.description: I have fallen down many fandom holes and can't get out. I apologise.

summary: Kit Harington Confirms Our Theory About Jon Snow's Post-Resurrection Hair
body:
Kit Harington Confirms Our Theory About Jon Snow’s Post-Resurrection Hair

Where’s all the metas about Jon Snow and Sansa Stark resembling Ned and Catelyn? Cuz you guys we’re on the money!!! Read it and weep haters! Lol!

“They wanted me to look more like Ned Stark,” Harington tells me, when I ask him about Snow’s sudden preference for the updo.
